Posts.Content: You have good reason to be frustrated, your husband needs to have a biopsy done, period. His numbers have been going up and now they are accelerating, not what you want to have to deal with but denial just isn't very effective. In my case my PSA number went up slightly, Dr. suggested a biopsy, Urologist thought I should have on "just to be safe". Surprise, surprise, I was a Gleason 9. Had surgery asap and so far so good. Ya never know and it's not something that is going to wait until "you" are ready to deal with it. Tell hubby to man up and do the right thing, if not for himself then for you. Good luck.
Posts.Signature: June 2015 PSA 6.4 July 2015 biopsy- 12/16 cores positive, all 8 on right side pos. Gleason 4+5=9 DaVinci prostatectomy 10-31-15 at UWashington, Seattle Dr. William Ellis highly recommend nerves on left spared pT3a catheter removed 9 days urinary incontinence for app. 4 weeks then rapid improvement. Dry since 8-1-16. ED-tried Cialis 5mg didn't like how it made me feel-discontinued after two months Slight improvement (5-10%) in ED after 9 months numb areas on right front and outside of right thigh PSA 12-15-15 <0.008 1-20-16 <0.008 4-20-16 <0.008 7-21-16 <0.008 11/16 <.008 5/17 <.008 10/17 <.008 4/18 <.008 10/18 <.008

Posts.Title: 3 month psa

Posts.Content: The reason I chose to have surgery was that if radiation and HT didn't kill the cancer surgery would be all but impossible. I had a Gleason 9 and was told that it was possible that the cancer had spread even though the scan was clear. I just wanted it out and the Da Vinci seemed like the best way to go. PSA's have been <0.008, 11 months out now. Continent, ED but slowly showing some improvement.
Posts.Title: Surgery success for Gleason 9

Posts.Title: Surgery success for Gleason 9

Posts.Content: Very well said SubDenis. Hearing for the first time "You have cancer" is a gut wrenching experience guaranteed to take whatever denial tendencies you may have to levels you never knew were possible. The loneliness, at least for me, came from wanting to appear strong for my wife while inside I wanted to cry like a two year old. You definitely have a solid grasp on what this disease actually does to you. One day at a time means something completely different to me now.
